sentences: Rigels Rajku (Albanian: [ɾiˈɡɛls ɾajˈku]; born 27 September 1986), known professionally as Noizy, is an Albanian rapper, singer, songwriter, actor and entrepreneur.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings =
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Rigels Rajku was born on 27 September 1986 into a multi-religious Albanian family in the village of Sukth, then part of the People's Socialist Republic, present Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: His father is a Muslim from Dibër and his mother a Catholic from Krujë.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 1997, Rajku and his family fled to London, England, as refugees to escape the war and conflicts in connection with the Albanian Civil War.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He was raised in the Woolwich neighborhood of Southeast London and subsequently developed an interest in boxing and street fighting.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2006, Rajku returned to his native country and appeared on the third edition of Top Fest, as a solo artist with the song "Jemi OTR" and as part of his group OTR with the song "Kështu e bëjme ne".
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In May 2007, he collaborated with Albanian rappers J-No and Decee and returned to the competition with the song "Kur vijm na".
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Later that year in November 2007, he unsuccessfully participated with the song "Veç për ty" in the 9th edition of Kënga Magjike and failed to qualify for the contest's semi-finals.
section: == Life and career == | === 1986–2010: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: In 2015, Rajku launched his fashion label Illyrian Bloodline represented with five branches in Albania, Kosovo and North Macedonia.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: Starting with the release of "Gangsta Love" in August 2015, the single received an award at the 2016 Netët e Klipit Shqiptar gala in Tirana, Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: In March 2017, the rapper was featured on German rapper Zuna's "Nummer 1", which peaked at number seven in Germany and became a certified Platinum-single by the German Bundesverband Musikindustrie (BVMI).
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: In June 2018, "Toto", a collaboration with Austrian rapper RAF Camora released under Warner Music, was also successful in German-speaking Europe, and was certified Gold in Austria, Germany and Switzerland, respectively.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: Another collaboration followed in December 2018 with the release of "Gango" by Greek rapper Snik, which eventually reached number one in Greece.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: In March 2019, Rajku was invited as a special guest at the Palmen aus Plastik Tour by RAF Camora and German rapper Bonez MC in Cologne, Germany.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: In June 2019, Rajku was approached to perform at the MAD Video Music Awards 2019 in Athens, Greece.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: In October 2019, he collaborated a second time with Snik on "Colpo Grosso" to commercial success in the latter country.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: Peaking at number 32 in Switzerlad, the rapper released his fifth studio album, Epoka, in April 2020.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: Two months after, he released his follow-up "All Dem Talk" featuring German rapper Gzuz and British rapper Dutchavelli in June 2020.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===

sentences: It peaked at number 16 in Switzerland and reached the top 30 in Austria and Germany, respectively.
section: == Life and career == | === 2011–present: Breakthrough and continued success ===
